title: Group Product Manager, Pixel Security
description: At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management.
key_qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in product management or related technical role.
5 years of experience taking technical products from conception to launch.
Experience developing consumer hardware or software security products.
preferred_qualifications:
Experience with the Android security model, cryptography, secure software design principles, memory safety, virtualization technologies, trusted execution environments, biometric security evaluation methodologies, and security certification schemes.
Experience with device software, operating systems, silicon, and other foundational blocks of the stack.
Experience inventing innovative and user-friendly products.
Experience shipping embedded security products.
Ability to think strategically and execute methodically.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
responsibilities:
Define the multi-year security roadmap, set clear priorities, and establish security requirements.
Collaborate with Silicon, Hardware, and Android teams to drive Pixel-specific security features and optimizations.
Guide teams to design, develop, and land user experiences with security and ensure that all of Pixel’s user experiences are implemented securely.
Articulate Pixel’s security narrative and user-facing commitments, align Pixel to tell a cohesive product story, and engage the marketing, PR, and policy teams to coordinate external communications.
